New Records: Kusal Mendis' 77-ball 122-run knock was the fastest hundred by a Sri Lankan in World Cup history
Key Match Events: Mendis and Samarawickrama starred in two 100-plus partnerships with Pathum Nissanka (51) to take Sri Lanka across the 200-mark in the 28th over
Mendis launched on Hasan Ali with successive sixes before holing out to Imam-ul-Haq
Pakistan conceded just 18 runs between 30 to 35 overs
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka posted their highest World Cup total against a Full Member
The pitch slowed down in the later stages of the match, affecting Pakistan's bowling
Others: For Pakistan, Hasan Ali (4/71) claimed four wickets and Haris Rauf (2/64) snapped two but overall it was a poor outing for the bowling unit
